page.title: 12Raglington Farm, Curdridge.
page.content: Raglington Farm is situated on the A334 near Silverlake in Curdridge. The farmhouse stands in 500 acres, 350 are farmland, and 150 woodland. The farm, once owned by William Cobbett, has existed for at least 450 years. The main crops are wheat, which goes to mills at Botley and Bishops Waltham for flour; oats, which go to Quakers for porridge; and barley, which is used for animal food. Other crops grown are peas, for animal food and{mushy}peas, potatoes, rhubarb, cauliflower, leeks and onions. There are also{pick your own}sweetcorn and runnerbeans. There are cattle for beef, Jacob sheep, pigs, 12,000 chicken, two donkeys and three bee hives. The farmer employs three workers full-time, and some part-time. He has a combine-harvester, & more machinery.
